file_content.text: I'm glad Doctor Carsiri's dead. He wouldn't have wanted this.
Thank you. We owe you our lives. Balmorra owes you her future.
Hurry! The lab can't take this kind of impact!
An open comm call is a blessing and a curse. I heard everything. Is Doctor Carsiri...?
He's dead, sir. The Sith's blade struck true.
It won't be in vain. Use the Barrager spike to take control. The Empire will never set foot on a Republic-protected world again.
But... didn't you hear what Doctor Carsiri said? The Barrager will suck Balmorra dry!
Doctor Carsiri made some serious claims, Commander.
That's a good point.
Explain yourself.
The Barrager draws power from every resource the host planet has. You'll stop an Imperial fleet, but you'll destroy what you're trying to protect.
No one asked you.
No one asked you.
But you'll listen to your Republic commander. You came to free Balmorra. What good is freedom if we have nothing left?
We have to make sacrifices for the greater good. Balmorra's could prevent another Telos, Taris or Coruscant.
We pay a heavy price for the Barrager's protection, but we have to use it.
This was Doctor Carsiri's dying wish. He wouldn't have helped you otherwise. Please, the Barrager must be destroyed.
We came here to protect Balmorra.
Destroy the Barrager.
To come all this way for nothing.... Do what you have to. As always, the Republic will clean up the mess.
The Barrager might be the difference between victory and defeat.
We need weapons. Grab it.
When the time comes, we'll have a choice. Install the Barrager spike. I'll send a squad to secure the lab.
We've all known we were working toward our own destruction. Only Doctor Carsiri did something about it.
The Barrager's yours now. I'm just glad Doctor Carsiri isn't here to see it.
We work night and day on the Barrager. It was a mistake to build it.
We have to get out of here. Evacuate, now!
The Barrager's self-destruct sequence latched onto a bunch of subsystems. This whole lab is going to blow.
